name: yt-dlp
description: yt-dlp is a command-line program to download videos from YouTube and other sites.

commands.name: yt-dlp
commands.description: yt-dlp is a command-line program to download videos from YouTube and other sites.

parameters.name: Help
parameters.description: Print this help text and exit

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: Print program version and exit

parameters.name: Update
parameters.description: Update this program to the latest version

parameters.name: No Update
parameters.description: Do not check for updates (default)

parameters.name: Update To Version
parameters.description: Upgrade/downgrade to a specific version. CHANNEL can be a repository as well. CHANNEL and TAG default to "stable" and "latest" respectively if omitted; See "UPDATE" for details. Supported channels: stable, nightly, master

parameters.name: Ignore Errors
parameters.description: Ignore download and postprocessing errors. The download will be considered successful even if the postprocessing fails

parameters.name: No Abort On Error
parameters.description: Continue with next video on download errors; e.g. to skip unavailable videos in a playlist (default)

parameters.name: Abort On Error
parameters.description: Abort downloading of further videos if an error occurs (Alias: --no-ignore-errors)

parameters.name: Dump User Agent
parameters.description: Display the current user-agent and exit

parameters.name: List Extractors
parameters.description: List all supported extractors and exit

parameters.name: Extractor Descriptions
parameters.description: Output descriptions of all supported extractors and exit

parameters.name: Use Extractors
parameters.description: Extractor names to use separated by commas. You can also use regexes, "all", "default" and "end" (end URL matching); e.g. --ies "holodex.*,end,youtube". Prefix the name with a "-" to exclude it, e.g. --ies default,-generic. Use --list-extractors for a list of extractor names. (Alias: --ies)

parameters.name: Default Search
parameters.description: Use this prefix for unqualified URLs. E.g. "gvsearch2:python" downloads two videos from google videos for the search term "python". Use the value "auto" to let yt-dlp guess ("auto_warning" to emit a warning when guessing). "error" just throws an error. The default value "fixup_error" repairs broken URLs, but emits an error if this is not possible instead of searching

parameters.name: Ignore Config
parameters.description: Don't load any more configuration files except those given to --config-locations. For backward compatibility, if this option is found inside the system configuration file, the user configuration is not loaded. (Alias: --no-config)

parameters.name: No Config Locations
parameters.description: Do not load any custom configuration files (default). When given inside a configuration file, ignore all previous --config-locations defined in the current file

parameters.name: Config Locations
parameters.description: Location of the main configuration file; either the path to the config or its containing directory ("-" for stdin). Can be used multiple times and inside other configuration files

parameters.name: Plugin Dirs
parameters.description: Path to an additional directory to search for plugins. This option can be used multiple times to add multiple directories. Use "default" to search the default plugin directories (default)

parameters.name: No Plugin Dirs
parameters.description: Clear plugin directories to search, including defaults and those provided by previous --plugin-dirs

parameters.name: Flat Playlist
parameters.description: Do not extract a playlist's URL result entries; some entry metadata may be missing and downloading may be bypassed

parameters.name: No Flat Playlist
parameters.description: Fully extract the videos of a playlist (default)

parameters.name: Preset Alias
parameters.description: Applies a predefined set of options. e.g. --preset-alias mp3. The following presets are available: mp3, aac, mp4, mkv, sleep. See the "Preset Aliases" section at the end for more info. This option can be used multiple times

parameters.name: Proxy
parameters.description: Use the specified HTTP/HTTPS/SOCKS proxy. To enable SOCKS proxy, specify a proper scheme, e.g. socks5://user:pass@127.0.0.1:1080/. Pass in an empty string (--proxy "") for direct connection

parameters.name: Socket Timeout
parameters.description: Time to wait before giving up, in seconds

parameters.name: Source Address
parameters.description: Client-side IP address to bind to

parameters.name: Impersonate
parameters.description: Client to impersonate for requests. E.g. chrome, chrome-110, chrome:windows-10. Pass --impersonate="" to impersonate any client. Note that forcing impersonation for all requests may have a detrimental impact on download speed and stability

parameters.name: List Impersonate Targets
parameters.description: List available clients to impersonate.

parameters.name: Force IPv4
parameters.description: Make all connections via IPv4

parameters.name: Force IPv6
parameters.description: Make all connections via IPv6

parameters.name: Enable File URLs
parameters.description: Enable file:// URLs. This is disabled by default for security reasons.

parameters.name: Geo Verification Proxy
parameters.description: Use this proxy to verify the IP address for some geo-restricted sites. The default proxy specified by --proxy (or none, if the option is not present) is used for the actual downloading

parameters.name: Fake X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: How to fake X-Forwarded-For HTTP header to try bypassing geographic restriction. One of "default" (only when known to be useful), "never", an IP block in CIDR notation, or a two-letter ISO 3166-2 country code

parameters.name: Playlist Items
parameters.description: Comma separated playlist_index of the items to download. You can specify a range using "[START]:[STOP][:STEP]". For backward compatibility, START-STOP is also supported. Use negative indices to count from the right and negative STEP to download in reverse order. E.g. "-I 1:3,7,-5::2" used on a playlist of size 15 will download the items at index 1,2,3,7,11,13,15

parameters.name: Min Filesize
parameters.description: Abort download if filesize is smaller than SIZE, e.g. 50k or 44.6M

parameters.name: Max Filesize
parameters.description: Abort download if filesize is larger than SIZE, e.g. 50k or 44.6M

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description: Download only videos uploaded on this date. The date can be "YYYYMMDD" or in the format [now|today|yesterday][-N[day|week|month|year]]. E.g. "--date today-2weeks" downloads only videos uploaded on the same day two weeks ago

parameters.name: Date Before
parameters.description: Download only videos uploaded on or before this date. The date formats accepted are the same as --date

parameters.name: Date After
parameters.description: Download only videos uploaded on or after this date. The date formats accepted are the same as --date

parameters.name: Match Filters
parameters.description: Generic video filter. Any "OUTPUT TEMPLATE" field can be compared with a number or a string using the operators defined in "Filtering Formats". You can also simply specify a field to match if the field is present, use "!field" to check if the field is not present, and "&" to check multiple conditions. Use a "\" to escape "&" or quotes if needed. If used multiple times, the filter matches if at least one of the conditions is met. E.g. --match-filters !is_live --match-filters "like_count>?100 & description~='(?i)\bcats \& dogs\b'" matches only videos that are not live OR those that have a like count more than 100 (or the like field is not available) and also has a description that contains the phrase "cats & dogs" (caseless). Use "--match-filters -" to interactively ask whether to download each video

parameters.name: No Match Filters
parameters.description: Do not use any --match-filters (default)

parameters.name: Break Match Filters
parameters.description: Same as "--match-filters" but stops the download process when a video is rejected

parameters.name: No Break Match Filters
parameters.description: Do not use any --break-match-filters (default)
